contextId.information: This describes something that might have happened but did not happen. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: Or I would have been lying ... that never see the light

contextId.information: The imperative in the first part of the sentence functions as a hypothetical condition. AT: "But if you were to ask the beasts, they would teach you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_imperative]] an [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
contextId.quote: But now ask the beasts, and they will teach you

contextId.information: In 31:5-40 Job describes different situations in which he would deserve God's punishment. But, he knows that they are not true and he is innocent. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])
